newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA TO USE FRANKFURT FOREIGN EXCHANGE FIX.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA TO USE FRANKFURT FOREIGN EXCHANGE FIX.

text.p: The Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) said it will use the daily Frankfurt foreign exchange fixings as a reference point for commercial transactions under the currency board regime which came into force on Tuesday.

"The central bank will use and publish the rates of main currencies as they are fixed on the Frankfurt foreign exchange at a given hour," Martin Zaimov, head of the central bank's issue department, told a news conference.
Until now, the BNB calculated a daily fixed rate for major currencies against the lev. On Tuesday, the lev was pegged at 1,000 to the mark in the currency board, rendering the practice obsolete.
Rates of foreign currencies not traded in Frankfurt will be taken from the respective national bank contributor pages on Reuters Terminals, said Zaimov. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-981-4145
